forecaster.ledger package¶

Submodules¶

forecaster.ledger.base module¶

TODO

class forecaster.ledger.base.Ledger(initial_year, inputs=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

An object with a next_year() method that tracks the curent year.

This object provides the basic infrastructure not only for advancing through a sequence of years but also for managing any recorded_property-decorated properties.

initial_year¶

The initial year for the object.

Type:int
this_year¶

The current year for the object. Incremented with each call to next_year()

Type:int
__init__(initial_year, inputs=None)[source]¶

Inits IncrementableByYear.

Behaviour when a year in inputs is equal to initial_year is undefined. Initialization is not guaranteed to respect such a value; if you want to set an initial-year value, it’s better to pass it as an appropriate argument at __init__ time.

Parameters:
  • initial_year (int) – The initial year for the object.
  • inputs (dict[str, dict[int, Any]]) – {property: {year: val}} pairs. Every val is treated as a manual entry that overrides any programmatic value for that year generated by next_year.
clear_cache()[source]¶

Clears all recorded_property_cached values for this year.

next_year()[source]¶

Advances to the next year.

class forecaster.ledger.base.LedgerType(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: type

A metaclass for Ledger classes.

This metaclass inspects the class for any @recorded_property-decorated methods and generates a corresponding _history method and _ dict attribute.

class forecaster.ledger.base.TaxSource(initial_year, inputs=None)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.ledger.base.Ledger

An object that can be considered when calculating taxes.

Provides standard tax-related properties, listed below.

Actual tax treatment will vary by subclass. Rather than override these properties directly, subclasses should override the methods _taxable_income, _tax_withheld, _tax_credit, and _tax_deduction (note the leading underscore).

taxable_income¶

Taxable income arising from the object for the current year.

Type:Money
tax_withheld¶

Tax withheld from the object for the current year.

Type:Money
tax_credit¶

Taxable credits arising from the object for the current year.

Type:Money
tax_deduction¶

Taxable deductions arising from the object for the current year.

Type:Money
taxable_income_history¶

Taxable income arising from the object for each year thus far.

Type:Money
tax_withheld_history¶

Tax withheld from the object for each year thus far.

Type:Money
tax_credit_history¶

Taxable credits arising from the object for each year thus far.

Type:Money
tax_deduction_history¶

Taxable deductions arising from the object for each year thus far.

Type:Money
tax_credit

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

tax_credit_history

Record of tax_credit over all past years.

tax_deduction

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

tax_deduction_history

Record of tax_deduction over all past years.

tax_withheld

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

tax_withheld_history

Record of tax_withheld over all past years.

taxable_income

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

taxable_income_history

Record of taxable_income over all past years.

class forecaster.ledger.money.Money(amount=Decimal('0.0'), currency=None)[source]¶

Bases: moneyed.classes.Money

Extends py-moneyed to support Decimal-like functions.

__eq__(other)[source]¶

Extends == operator to allow comparison with Decimal.

This allows for comparison to 0 (or other Decimal-convertible values), but not with other Money objects in different currencies.

__gt__(other)[source]¶

Extends > operator to allow comparison with 0

__hash__()[source]¶

Allows for use in sets and as dict keys.

__init__(amount=Decimal('0.0'), currency=None)[source]¶

Initializes with application-level default currency.

Also allows for initializing from another Money object.

__lt__(other)[source]¶

Extends < operator to allow comparison with 0

__round__(ndigits=None)[source]¶

Rounds to ndigits

default_currency = 'CAD'¶

forecaster.ledger.recorded_property module¶

Module providing property-like decorators for Ledger subclasses.

class forecaster.ledger.recorded_property.recorded_property(fget=None, doc=None)[source]¶

Bases: property

A decorator for properties that record their annual amounts.

Methods decorated with this decorator (a) are decorated with the @property decorator, and (b) sets a recorded_property flag attribute on the decorated property.

recorded_property-decorated properties are processed by the Ledger metaclass to automatically generate have a <name>_history property, and a _<name> dict attribute to the class.

Example:

class ExampleLedger(Ledger):
    @recorded_property
    def taxable_income(self):
        return <formula for taxable_income>
__init__(fget=None, doc=None)[source]¶

Init recorded_property.

This wraps the getter received via the @recorded_property decoration into a method that returns a value from a dict of recorded values if such a value is present for the key self.this_year. If not, it calls the getter. No setter may be provided; this decorator automatically generates one based on this dict of recorded values.

class forecaster.ledger.recorded_property.recorded_property_cached(fget=None, doc=None)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.ledger.recorded_property.recorded_property

A recorded property that is cached by Ledger classes.

__init__(fget=None, doc=None)[source]¶

Overrides the property getter to cache on first call.

Module contents¶

A package for providing ledgers (i.e. historical datasets).
